intro: Hyoseris maroccana, commonly known as the Moroccan hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It produces yellow flowers with ray florets, and its seeds are dispersed by wind. Hyoseris maroccana is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptability to harsh environments.
